dataList.content: What was the secret technique honorable Fixer Lysander employed in his resolution of the case of the Fae Forest? Speak its name in full!
I-I've got it! It's, uh, A Summer Night Fantasia!

Ah, ah! Yet I cannot let pass such an unmotivated retelling of his super ultimate move! Hardly could one internalize the true, noble spirit of Fixers by simply reciting it with such apathy. Thou must recreate the exact pose and the enunciation!
A-are you kidding me...?!
Phooooooooh...
C'mon. You can do this, Jia Xichun. You can do this. This is nothing...!
I-illusions of a midsummer night... shall devour thee whole...
SUMMER, NIGHT~ FANTASIA!
Thine enunciation was quite shaky upon the word "illusions", yet...
... heh, thou hast demonstrated sufficient courage. Thus I bestow upon thee this badge.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I grow tired of this nonsense... Just how much longer are you planning to drag this on?!

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: ... thus muttered the hero, then declared: "I shall tear this evil storm asunder and find a place for this blade at the center of thy heart!"
Dante, lights! Left side!
<G-gotcha!>
Don Quixote, who was watching Sinclair and Jia Xichun's two-person play, silently wiped her tears away.

Bravo, bravo... Certain minor details were missed, such as that Yue Fei the Fixer was left-handed, and that he had a habit of playing with a lighter in his left pocket before every duel, yet... 'twas a wonderful reenactment indeed! I have no other critique to impart upon thee!
When faced with great adversity in thine adventures, rekindle the memory of Yue Fei the Fixer's final duel. Remember it well...
Thus cometh to an end, the lessons of to-day...

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Huh... It was just for a moment, but I think I'm starting to get it.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I get why she's so obsessed with Fixers...
Clutched tightly in Xichun's hands were the badges Don Quixote had gifted to her.
